name: Slum City
title: Highest Urban Population Living in Slums
description: In 2016, 94.2% of South Sudan's urban population lived in slums, the highest percentage globally.

name: Budget Busters
title: Excessive Government Expenditure
description: In 2022, South Sudan's government expenditures were 168% of the original approved budget, indicating significant overspending.

name: School's Out
title: High Rate of Children Out of School
description: In 2015, 63% of primary school-aged children in South Sudan were not attending school, one of the highest rates worldwide.

name: Over-Aged Learners
title: High Percentage of Over-Age Students in Primary Education
description: In 2015, over 50% of male students and 48.6% of all students in primary schools were over-aged, indicating educational delays.

name: Crowded Classrooms
title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Lower Secondary Education
description: In 2015, the pupil-teacher ratio in South Sudan's lower secondary schools was 46.7, indicating overcrowded classrooms.

name: Infant Mortality Crisis
title: High Infant Mortality Rates
description: In 2023, South Sudan had an infant mortality rate of 72.6 per 1,000 live births, with male infants at 78.3 and female infants at 66.8, among the highest globally.

name: Neonatal Challenges
title: High Neonatal Mortality Rate
description: In 2023, the neonatal mortality rate in South Sudan was 40.2 per 1,000 live births, indicating significant health challenges for newborns.

name: Poverty Stricken
title: High Poverty Headcount Ratio
description: In 2016, 82.3% of South Sudan's population lived below the national poverty line, highlighting severe economic challenges.

name: Food Insecurity Alert
title: High Prevalence of Severe Food Insecurity
description: In 2022, 63.2% of South Sudan's population experienced severe food insecurity, one of the highest rates globally.

name: Youthful Nation
title: High Percentage of Youth Population
description: In 2023, 12.9% of the male and 12.3% of the female population in South Sudan were aged 15-19, indicating a youthful demographic.

name: Power Outage Capital
title: Lowest Access to Electricity
description: In 2023, only 5.4% of South Sudan's population had access to electricity, with urban access slightly higher at 19.1%.

name: Corruption Chronicles
title: High Corruption Levels
description: South Sudan's control of corruption estimate in 2023 was -1.97, placing it among the lowest globally.

name: Banking Blues
title: Low Financial Inclusion
description: In 2021, only 5.83% of South Sudan's population aged 15+ had an account at a financial institution or mobile-money-service provider.

name: Education Enigma
title: Low School Enrollment Rates
description: In 2015, the primary completion rate was 20.55%, with secondary enrollment at 5.48% and tertiary at 1.00%.

name: Fertile Grounds
title: Minimal Fertilizer Use
description: In 2022, South Sudan's fertilizer consumption was 0.0006 kg per hectare, one of the lowest globally.

name: Governance Gaps
title: Low Government Effectiveness
description: The government effectiveness estimate in 2023 was -2.33, indicating significant challenges in public administration.

name: Tourism Tumble
title: Minimal Tourism Expenditure
description: In 2020, international tourism expenditures were just $1 million, reflecting limited tourism activity.

name: Energy Exporter
title: Negative Energy Imports
description: In 2022, South Sudan had a net energy import value of -859.50%, indicating it exports more energy than it imports.
